Reviews.Title: “Nice accommodating hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Scott W
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this Ramada about a week ago because of a family member's funeral. Upon checking in the staff was great and very helpful. We stayed for three nights and on our second night there was a bit of an issue. Maybe the walls are thin, or our neighbors were extremely loud! But we were traveling with our two children and the sounds from the neighbors room were not something that they should be hearing. My wife complained about it to Quianna at the front desk in the morning. She was extremely helpful and said she would give us a free upgrade to their other building as soon as there was a room available. We were expecting a regular room but were actually upgraded to a large suite because of the unfortunate issue the night before. This actually worked out great for us, and our last night there couldn't have been better. The continental breakfast was actually pretty good also, and we made good use of the free wifi. If I'm ever back in the area I will be staying here again just because of the warm customer service we received by the front desk when we arrived with our issue. Overall great stay minus the second night, and great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: drpaulSeattle
Reviews.Content: We needed a room at the last minute while visiting in the Northridge area. The Ramada was clean, quiet, and comfortable. Parking was easy. The building we were in was off the street, so was very quiet. Nice beds, plenty of space, bathroom was good. The Continental Breakfast was typical of these kind of hotels, but nothing to write home about. All in all it was a good experience, and if we need a place again in this area we would go back. We had a much better experience here than we had previously with a nearby competitor hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This place creeped me out.”
Reviews.Author: rahir
Reviews.Content: Traveling for work, I stayed at the Ramada Inn for one night. To be honest, the place creeped me out. The staff were adequate, but didn't smile or offer much besides, "Here's your room card." The room was old looking, with one of those old-style comforter covers, and the mattress sagged in the middle. The bathroom had an odd mustard-yellow ting from the lights and was in serious need of a facelift. Parking also became tight towards the evening. This was an OK stay for simply passing through town on business, but in the future I'd stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: katauon n
Reviews.Content: Clean and very comfortable room, friendly very helpful staff.Location is nice and quite. my overall experience was great.

Reviews.Title: “"Aging, but reasonably pleasant"”
Reviews.Author: mohit2
Reviews.Content: Good location, quiet, clean room and comfortable beds. Everything worked. It was raining and the glass window in our room leaked, but that wasn't a big inconvenience. Biggest issue is there weren't enough linens and it was necessary to go to the front desk to get more. The person at the front desk didn't know what "linens" meant. (-:

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: Lax2Hou
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 1 night during the week. I checked in and felt like I was checking into a hotel that rents by the hour. The front desk agent was nice, but even though I confirmed a room with 1 king bed, she said the didn't have any available and could put me in a room with 2 double beds (smoking) I told her that was unacceptable and that was not what I confirmed. She immediately gave me an attitude and then miraculously found a Handicapped room, non smoking with a king bed, but she then wanted me to pay more! I refused and she finally gave me that room at the quoted rate. Not my idea of fun. The parking lot was also pretty bad, small spots and I had to park far away from the registration area. Then haul all my luggage through the parking lot, on an elevator and down a long hallway.

Reviews.Title: “It's an ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: casinocim
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while visiting family, not many hotels in this area. The hotel was fine. We were told by family not to wander outside of the hotel at night. I smoke and did not feel comfortable enough to go out alone at night for a puff. There is a grocery store(Ralph's) across the street we walked to and some other little shops. I think there were some places to eat in there but not positive. There is a McDonalds about three blocks away but not sure I would want to walk that far to it after told not to walk around at night. They were some roof tiles missing on the front building which did not look good. We were in the building at the back of the hotel. You needed to use your room key to get in the building. The room was clean, the beds were fairly comfortable. There was not a safe in the room but the front desk has safety deposit boxes for use. Pool did not look clean, boys did not want to swim in it. Front desk said it was not heated. There is a jacuzzi. Front desk clerks were friendly. The comp breakfast in the morning was fairly good. Waffles, cereal, hard boiled eggs, juice, milk, pastries... I would stay here again, wish they would fix those roof tiles.

Reviews.Title: “We will return!”
Reviews.Author: wykydjd
Reviews.Content: We arrived without a reservation and the staff was very understanding and accomodating-even though it was "NBA All-Star Weekend". We were treated very well and even though we overslept the day of checkout, they were very respectful with the courtesy calls. My only complaint, as with most places in California, was the size of the parking lot. Even though we parked on-site, maneuvering within the parking lot was very diffucult, even with a mid-sized car.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, I am really impressed.”
Reviews.Author: Baronent
Reviews.Content: This property is listed as a 2 star. I expected a 2 star. If you are ever in need of a place to stay in Chatsworth, this place is outstanding for the money! Right across the street from Ralphs grocery store and PLENTY of places to grab some food. Rooms are decent for a 2 star. Nice sized and super clean. Fridge in the room always helps. We stayed at a 4 star Sheraton the week prior. Let me tell you what I liked about this place over the more than DOUBLE the cost, Sheraton. 1. Free parking Sheraton:$18/day 2. Free high speed internet Sheraton:$12/day 3. Amazing staff. 4. Free breakfast (Hard boiled eggs, breads, fresh waffles, fruit etc...) Sheraton: Room Service? After all the fee's. $$$$$ Get this: My wife tried to tip a guy for bringing something to the room. He DECLINED the tip stating "it is my job". Ok, I have not seen that before and I travel a LOT! We have twin 3 year old boys. The room was a MESS with toys. The cleaning crew actually took the time to out the toys away and straighten everything in the room. The cleaning/upkeep on the room was more like that of the Four Seasons. Seriously! Most cleaning crews just toss the toys aside, this place actually organized! So unless I look at my credit card statement and see that they charged me $400 in extra fee's, I have to tell you that for a 2 star property, in Chatsworth, this place is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Crib for baby = SLEEP”
Reviews.Author: JDJ2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a night of no sleep due to another hotel not having a crib for our child even-though they said they did prior to us booking. This hotel let us book the reservation, check-in early and had a crib in our room within 45min span. They were very accommodating and pleasant. Quiana (sp?) was very nice on the phone and I couldn't have been happier with our stay here. The room was a standard room, clean, fresh towels and sheets, and a large bed. They had a continental breakfast in the morning from 6:30-10am which was a lot better than the previous hotel we stayed at. The only problem I had with their breakfast was that 70% of the milk in the fridge was expired by about 2weeks. But all the expiration dates were facing forward and easily in view. The hotel was quiet and comfortable and very reasonably priced. I would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value... If you can over look the uncleanliness.”
Reviews.Author: adventurelady76
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the great customer service at the front desk. I had been trying to book a room all day online and my connection on my iPhone was horrible at the amusement park we were at. I told the front desk about my issue and she honored the 2 day stay online price. I was a bit unsatisfied with the cleanliness of the rooms. They seemed to just be surface cleaned. The second day I stayed the room was a bit cleaner. Probably a different housekeeper. The breakfast room was dingy and jelly from the day before was still on the breakfast table. The toasters and juice machine needed a good daily cleaning or at least a wipe down. My other complaint would be while trying to eat breakfast there was someone spraying furniture polish cleaning the lobby. That is not a good smell for your palate. Also I would suggest the maids to eat before work and not use up the space and appliances made for paying customers. We were on a tight time schedule and there were three housekeepers in uniforms toasting their bagels in a leisurely fashion. The one maid kept using the toaster improperly shoving the lever up to check her toast instead of using the temp knob or the cancel button. So no wonder they don't work well with the daily improper use. They must have been on their union mandated break, until the matinence supervisor came in and they rushed out of the breakfast room. So while having your breakfast please clean the tables, juice machine buttons and tray, remove the stale bagels and Danishes, wipe down fridge, and tongs. Pretty good selection for breakfast just not the cleanest environment. The room could use some dusting, the light switches wiped down, walls wiped clean, the hair dryer was dirty, and the carpet needed cleaned. This is coming from someone who is very particular and wanted to save some cash. Shower was clean and so was the linens. Those are my important points. My other complaint was I decided to stay in the area another night and they couldn't accommodate a third night at a good rate after I checked out. Clean enough to sleep and shower. A good selection for a free breakfast. Great value for the area. Being a single mom I felt extremely safe with the closed in style rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: AussieOwl
Reviews.Content: I have no idea where the folks giving 5-star reviews are staying... but it isn't here! Rooms are dingy, and not fully cleaned. Bathroom tiles are cracked. The walls are thin - you can hear other guests in their rooms. The noise outside the hotel was loud also. The staff was not concerned about speed or making you wait to check-in. It was an overall disgusting experience. We will need to come to this area again (our daughter attends college at CSUN), but we will find another hotel, even if it's MILES away.

Reviews.Title: “Best value out there!”
Reviews.Author: basedgod
Reviews.Content: I came to visit my family in Chatsworth and stayed at the Ramada. I made my reservation online because of the price and didn't expect much. But to my surprise, It was a wonderful experience. The staff was very friendly/welcoming, it was an extremely hot day when I arrived and the the front desk offered me a free bottle of cold water. The room was spacious, the beds were comfortable, and they even offered a free continental breakfast. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BAD EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: GRUMPY69061
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel for 6 years whenever we visit relatives and friends from our old area. I called & got a 2 night stay @ a very reasonable rate and within a few hours my relative calls and says they will be coming in the following week instead. Within 24 hours of making the reservation, I called to cancel.......and was told it was a special rate so you can't cancel. I have never canceled in the past. After I was told No, I called the Hotel's Headquarters and was told that this is a franchise owner and they cannot force them to do the right thing. We finally gave up and went down there for 1 of the 2 nights, but will NEVER stay there again. On the following week, we came down and stayed at the Airtel Hotel which was also quite reasonable. Owners of the Ramada need a Business course and should be better at filtering out the real Jackoffs as opposed to their true customers. What jerks............NEVER AGAIN! I will continue to tell everyone.......

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant staff.”
Reviews.Author: happy_feet86
Reviews.Content: Even though this hotel is 20 minutes from our parents house we always stay here. Sure there are closer hotels, but we just love this hotel. The hotel is very clean and very quiet. The front desk is always very helpful. We plan on staying there next time we come to California.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: bmma
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were visiting family in Northridge, CA but we couldn't find any that accepted our small dog with out charging a fortune. Fortunately we found this one only 5 minutes away, they only charged $10 extra. We were impresed by the size of the room, there rooms are bigger than most hotels we've been to. The staff went out of there way to help us, they even let us check out late at no extra charge. We highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Bad first impression caused me to leave”
Reviews.Author: Dexter_Sweeney
Reviews.Content: I can't in good conscience write a full review of this establishment as my initial check-in experience caused me not to stay there. I'll bullet-point the reasons I chose not to stay: - Trash strewn in the parking lot - Absent front-desk clerk (watching TV in another room until I called for some assistance) - Lackluster service - the clerk was uninterested and apathetic - Foul odor on the 2nd floor in the second building - Broken door or broken room keys, I don't know which. After hauling my luggage from the front desk to the room two times and back again because the door would not open, I did not particularly care what the problem was. The overall feel of the place is run-down and dingy. For a last-minute one night stay it might be sufficient, but I was looking for a week long stay for business. If any one of the above gripes had been the only issue I would not have thought twice, but when I start making laundry lists of what's wrong it's time to look for somewhere else to spend my time.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experiance”
Reviews.Author: ERICA48
Reviews.Content: Front Desk and Housekeeping Staff were all very friendly Great Hotel to Stay in Excellent Service Highly Recomended

Reviews.Title: “worst experence ever”
Reviews.Author: herbgal8
Reviews.Content: Last night I had the worst experence I've ever had at a hotel when staying at the Ramada Inn in Chatsworth,CA. My daughter and I booked one night so we could do some shopping for her wedding and by the next morning we realized that another night would be needed so we could get everything done. At around 10 AM I called the front desk and asked if we could have the room for another night. We were assured we could and that it was all taken care of and it would be added to our bill. The nightmare started that evening around 9 PM when we tried to use our key cards to get back into the hotel building and they weren't accepted. I went to the front desk and was told that ALL of our belongings were taked from our room and stored downstairs!! Shocked, I asked for the manager and when he arrived he just said " I needed your room for someone else so I moved you out. I'll put you in a suite to make up for it" With no where to stay and dead on our feet we agreed----until we saw the ONE bed we were supposed to share! Then we started going through our things and realized the contents of our frige were taken out and left in the heat of the day---including the expensive skin care I had bought the day before. The manager lied and said there wasn't any skin care in the fridge and he had moved us himself. When we were left alone to go though our things and decided not to stay in the suite, the manager had said he would be right outside but when we looked for him he was gone and could not be reached by phone. I called HIS "boss" and when we realized we were being charged for 2 nights----because we had CHECKED OUT LATE!!!! I reminded him that THEY had virtually checked us out when they took our things out of our room without our permission! That's when he threatened to call the police to remove us from the property! We drove the 4 hours home rather then going to the slammer. Great customer relations at the Ramada Inn Chatsworth, wouldn't you say?? signed, bent out of shape and sooo tired

Reviews.Title: “Virtual picutures tour is VERY DECEIVING, BELEIVE ME”
Reviews.Author: Oceansidebear
Reviews.Content: The tour you see on line with this hotel is not at all what the hotel truly is when inside. The lobby is dirty, tiles are dirty and my 80 year old father could not even go in the lobby restroom, due to water or whatever all over the floor. The bar is dirty and and has holes in the wall and the bar stools are filithy and I and several of the customers witness mice coming inside the bar area from the back entrance right into the bar. The hotel allows pets and you can smell the pet ordor as you walk into the lobby of the back building. The pet pee was very strong. I will say that the room itself was fair, but found candy on the floor under the lip of the bed. The coffee pot had not been cleaned, for I found old grounds in the filter along with old tea bags in the filter. Again what you see on line is not what you get. I would not stay in this Ramada Again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a "Base Camp" in the Simi Vallley/San Fernando Valley area”
Reviews.Author: jJNB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four nights here May 25-28, 2007. Cheerful and courteous attendants at the check in counter in the Lobby. Self-service luggage carts and a large elevator. Some covered parking. Our room on the 2nd floor of the first unit (there are two units) was neat, clean and comfortable. 2 Queen Size Beds, a large TV (all channels), an armoire with several drawers, a desk , 2 chairs, a night stand , a small clothes closet and a small fridge. The bath was larger than usual and had a full tub/shower with a hand held shower attachment. The (attractive) Lobby and parking spaces (some handicapped near the Lobbby entrance) are on the ground floor, rooms on the 2nd and 3rd floors. Vending machines on 2nd floor, ice machine on 3rd. Nice pool and hot tub outside just off the Lobby entrance. Convenient location a few blocks off the Ronald Reagan Freeway (California State Highway 118) with interchanges at Topango Canyon and Desoto streets. The Ronald Reagan Library and Museum is about 20 miles west (Don't miss the Air Force One walk-through). The Internet rate for the room for 3 persons, 2 beds, was $84.60 plus tax, about half the rate for other motels in the area. Most likely would stay here again. Also convenient to the Chatsworth AMTRAK/Metrolink Park and Ride (free parking) Rail Station a few blocks west and south of Devonshire Street. There was some noise from the AMTRAK and Metrolink Trains, but not objectionable and usually hardly noticeable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, depressed neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was quite adequate, although the air conditioner could have been more efficient. Plan to dine before you arrive though. The on-site restaurant is actually a bar with a few small tables. I found it filled with loud, "rough" looking people (perhaps from the surrounding "depressed" neighborhood) and walked out. Some outdoor seating, but not the kind of neighborhood one would want to walk in after dark or look at while dining. Not a good place to dine with kids...stick to room service. No other restaurants within reasonable walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Clean!”
Reviews.Author: kalliekoko
Reviews.Content: The front desk personnel were friendly and helpful. The room was clean, beds were comfy & the only thing missing was a microwave! View is nothing overly exciting & you do hear the train pass by once in a blue moon, but you adjust (or close your window!). Parking lot a bit noisey late at night with rude people & their loud music, but you cannot help that. Parking lot very well lit. Restaurant had limited menu for b/l/d and did not look that exciting (the actual restaurant)...we did not try the food. The bar/lounge, was clean, cool and that of a typical bar. Would definitly stay there again. Good price for what we got & did not worry about dirt, bugs, etc.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: rfd2112
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for the price. Excellent breakfast. Clean room, friendly staff. Stayed on my way to visit the Reagan Library in Simi Valley and play Lost Canyons golf course, I highly recommend both.
